subject: Re: Failure in @Before not reflected in Eclipse plugin runner
msgSnippet: I haven t tested the @Before yet, but as of 3.2RC7 the failures in @BeforeClass exceptions /are/ being reported in the runner. thanks!
messageBody:
I haven't tested the @Before yet, but as of 3.2RC7 the failures in
@BeforeClass exceptions /are/ being reported in the runner.

thanks!

David Saff wrote:
> Barry,
>
> I'm sorry no one's responded to this yet. Have you tried this again
> with the latest Eclipse 3.2 release candidate? The JUnit 4 support has
> been dramatically improved. Good luck,
>
> David Saff
>
> Barry Kaplan wrote:
>
>> I have a test with a @Before method that is throwing an exception. The
>> exception is caught by the BeforeAndAfterRunner which invokes addFailure
>> executing "notifier.fireTestFailure(...).
>>
>> None of the actual test methods for this test get executed as expected.
>> However, in the eclipse plugin the node for that test is green as are
>> all of
>> the subnodes for the methods. The nodes don't have the check
>> annotation, but
>> no indication that a failure occured is provided. The exception message is
>> completely eaten.
>>
>> The only way I was able to determine what why that tests was not run
>> was to
>> debug into the Junit4.1 code.
>>
>> Is this a know issue, or might I be missing something?
>>
>> thanks!
>> --
>> View this message in context:
>> http://www.nabble.com/Failure-in-%40Before-not-reflected-in-Eclipse-plugin-runner-t1591178.html#a4317937
>> Sent from the JUnit - User forum at Nabble.com.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
